front.title: Adding acronyms to simplify DANE conversations

abstract.t: Experience has show that people get confused using the three numeric fields the TLSA record. This document specifies descriptive acronyms for the three numeric fields in the TLSA records.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: During discussions on how to add DANE technology to new protocols/services people repeatedly have got confused as what the numeric values stand for and even the order of the fields of a TLSA record. This document updates the IANA registry definition for TLSA record to add a column with acronym for each specified field, in order to reduce confusion. This document does not change the DANE protocol in any way.
It is expected that DANE parsers in applications and DNS software can adopt parsing the acronyms for each field.

section.title: IANA considerations
section.t: This document applies to "DNS-Based Authentication of Named Entities (DANE) Parameters" located at "http://www.iana.org/assignments/dane-parameters/dane-parameters.xhtml". Each one of the Sub-registries will add a column with an acronym for that field.
and this document are both to be the reference documents for the three sub-registries.
As these acronyms are offered for human consumption, case does not matter, it is expected that software that parses TLSA records will handle either upper or lower case use as input.

section.title: TLSA records using/displaying the acronyms:
section.t:
_666._tcp.first.example. TLSA PKIX-CA CERT SHA2-512 {blob}
_666._tcp.second.example. TLSA DANE-TA SPKI SHA2-256 {blob}

section.title: Acronym use in a specification example:
section.t: Protocol FOO only allows TLSA records using PKIX-EE and DANE-EE, with selector SPKI and using SHA2-512.

section.title: Security considerations
section.t: This document only changes registry fields and does not change the behavior of any protocol. The hope is to reduce confusion and lead to better specification and operations.
